title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
WINTER 

EOC

WINTER EOC

summary:
**Individual Testing (12/3-12/5):** For students who still need to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (12/16-12/19):** ONLY for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class, administered during exam week. Make-up testing: 1/7-1/8.

Emails will be sent to students and parents before Thanksgiving Break with specific test details. Questions should be directed to **Mrs. Hess: hessb@talawanda.org**

title: Finals Week Schedule December 16-19
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
FINALS 

WEEK

FINALS WEEK

summary:
**Finals Week runs December 16-19, 2025.** Students should arrive by 11:10 AM on 12/17, 12/18, and 12/19, and only need to attend classes with exams. Buses still depart at 2:30 PM.

**Tuesday 12/16:** Full day schedule with 0 Bell (7:30-7:50), regular periods, and 7th Period Exam (1:00-2:30 PM).

**Wednesday 12/17:** 1st Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40 AM), 2nd Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

**Thursday 12/18:** 3rd Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40 AM), 4th Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

**Friday 12/19:** 5th Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40 AM), 6th Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

title: Senior Cap and Gown Order Deadline
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
SENIORS

SENIORS

Talawanda Senior Families:Graduation is just around the corner........ Senior caps and gowns need to be ordered by December 6th to receive the reduced price of $66.69. After December 6th the price goes up.Please see the flyer below for Graduation information from Jostens. You can also visit JOSTENS.COM to order.

summary: **Senior cap and gown orders must be placed by December 6th** to receive the discounted price of **$66.69**. After December 6th, the price increases to $65.00 plus service/shipping and sales tax. Orders can be placed online at **JOSTENS.COM** or through the school during lunch (dates TBD). The gown is a rental and must be returned after graduation; students keep their cap, tassel, and stole. The Custom "Mascot Package" (flyer enclosed) includes cap, rental gown, tassel, and stole for $54.95 plus fees with online ordering.

event_info.title: Senior Cap and Gown Order Deadline (Reduced Price)
event_info.description: **Senior cap and gown orders must be placed by December 6th** to receive the discounted price of **$66.69**. After December 6th, the price increases to $65.00 plus service/shipping and sales tax. Orde

title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Senior Yearbook Portrait Information 
Follow these instructions to submit your portrait for the 2026 yearbook!1. Use the link - https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0jPvxM8 2. Use the access code: talawanda20263. Upload a picture greater than 1MBIf you are submitting a senior portrait, please follow these rules!Photos must be submitted in portrait format, NOT landscapePhoto must be greater than 1MB in filesizePortrait must follow the student code of conduct - no guns, drugs, etcBlack and white photos are DISCOURAGEDThe deadline to submit a senior photo is MARCH 27th! Don't wait until the last minute!

summary: Seniors must submit their portraits for the **2026 yearbook** by **March 27th**. Upload photos at [snap.yearbookforever.com](https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0jPvxM8) using access code **talawanda2026**. Photos must be in portrait format (not landscape), greater than 1MB filesize, follow the student code of conduct, and black and white photos are discouraged.

event_info.title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Deadline
event_info.description: Seniors must submit their portraits for the **2026 yearbook** by **March 27th**. Upload photos at [snap.yearbookforever.com](https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0

BUTLER TECH
You can apply hereFor more details, click here

summary: Butler Tech's application window is now open for **1-Year, 2-Year, and 3-Year programs**. Prospective students can visit through small group tours (9AM-12PM) or open houses (4-7 PM). **Small group tours** are available for 2Y Programs on Dec 6, Dec 13, Jan 24, and Jan 31, and for 3Y Programs on Jan 31, Feb 7, and Feb 28. **Open houses** are scheduled for Jan 15, 2026 (all 2Y campuses: BSC, DRL, NSC, SOA) and March 5, 2026 (all 3Y campuses: AM Hub, Aviation, BSC, DRL). [Apply here](https://www.butlertech.org/admissions/application/) | [More details](https://www.butlertech.org/admissions/)

blocks.content:
CLUB 

MEETINGS

CLUB MEETINGS

*No club meetings this week due to Thanksgiving Break*Monday, December 1stDiversity Club 2:30pm -3:30pm - room 400 Setting Stone 2:30pm - 3:30pm - room 320Tribune 2:30pm - 3:30pm - room 315Tuesday, December 2ndArt Club 2:30pm - 3:30pm - room 603Diversity Club 2:30pm -3:30pm - room 400Key Club 9:30am - 10:00am (tutorial) - room 218Mock Trial 5:00pm - 7:00pm - room 315Robotics Club 2:30pm - 4:00pm - room 412, All are welcome!Wednesday, December 3rdThursday, December 4thChess Club 2:30 - 3:30pm - room 603Mock Trial 5:00pm - 7:00pm - room 315 Project Green 2:30pm - 3:30pm - room 224, All are welcome!Robotics Club 2:30pm - 4:00pm - room 412Friday, December 5thDrama Production of Little Women 7:00pm - PACSaturday, December 6thDrama Production of Little Women 2:00pm & 7:00pm - PAC

title: Little Women Musical Performance at THS
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: This family friendly Broadway musical features the heartwarming 1868 story by Louisa May Alcott of the 4 March sisters as they navigate life during the Civil War, the trials of becoming individuals, and their pursuits for happiness in very different circumstances. The production features performances and tech work of close to 20 THS students from all class levels, with many contributions from Oxford community members. Tickets may be purchased at this LINK or with cash at the door.

summary: **Little Women: The Musical** will be performed by Talawanda High School Drama Club at the THS Performing Arts Center. This family-friendly Broadway musical tells Louisa May Alcott's 1868 story of the March sisters during the Civil War. Shows are **December 5th at 7 PM**, **December 6th at 2 PM and 7 PM**. Tickets are **$8** and can be purchased [online](https://www.talawanda.org) or with cash at the door. Nearly 20 THS students from all grades participate, with contributions from Oxford community members.

summary:
**Talawanda School District** offers multiple food assistance programs for families in need:

- **Little Free Pantries** available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more as needed
- **Backpack Program** at all elementary buildings provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays (contact building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
- Access a **calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule**, **list of all Butler County food pantries**, and **SNAP information** via the provided links

summary:
The Talawanda School District provides multiple food assistance resources for families:
- **Little Free Pantries** are available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or as needed
- **Backpack Program** provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at all elementary buildings (contact your building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food Boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours

Additional resources include a [calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule](link), [list of all Butler County food pantries](link), and [SNAP information](link). Contact information for Social Workers at Kramer (Chelsea Pike: 513-273-3511, pikec@talawanda.org), Marshall (Chrissy Rolfes: 513-273-3611, rolfesc@talawanda.org), and Bogan (Emily White: 513-273-3403, whitee@talawanda.org), plus Success Liaisons at TMS (Lydia Schrag: 513-273-3311, schragl@talawanda.org) and THS (Chris Robertson: 513-273-3224, robertsonc@talawanda.org) is provided.

title: BRAVE Day for Sophomore Class
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
BRAVE 

DAY

BRAVE DAY

BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family building, diversity, and anti-bullying event for **sophomores only**, taking place on **Friday, November 14th**. Students participate in activities and share stories to build community, realize they're not alone, and understand their important role with classmates. Attendance is optional—students who prefer not to participate should stay in their regular classes during the event.

All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. **RSVP required**: scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. Event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS and RSVP approval is required for attendance.

PUSH Program
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary: **PUSH Program** provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, call Jeanne or Sabrina at **513-523-8100** or visit [push-oxford.org](http://www.push-oxford.org/).

title: Food Resources Available for Families
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Calendar 

of 

community 

meals 

and 

TOPPS 

schedule

Calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule

List 

of 

all 

Butler 

County 

food 

pantries

List of all Butler County food pantries

SNAP 

information

SNAP information

summary:
The Talawanda School District provides several food resources for families in need:
- **Little Free Pantries** are available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more
- **Backpack Program** provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at elementary buildings (contact your building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
- Additional resources include a **calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule**, a **list of all Butler County food pantries**, and **SNAP information**

title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
EOC 

TESTING

EOC TESTING

summary:
**Individual Testing (December 3-5):** For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not currently enrolled in the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (December 16-19):** Only for students currently taking Algebra C or Government classes, administered during exam week. Make-up testing available January 7-8.

Emails with specific test requirements and details will be sent to students and parents/guardians before Thanksgiving Break. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org.

title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Donate and Save Lives
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
FCCLA

FCCLA

summary: FCCLA is hosting a **blood drive on November 7, 2025** from **8:00 AM to 12:00 PM** at the **Talawanda High School Auxiliary Gym**. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate blood to help address the American blood shortage and support those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and medical needs. The event is TSD approved for distribution, and participants will receive free snacks and a 1-hour rest period. For more information, contact **+513-273-3200** or **CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG**.
